content: berkshires socks designed by melissa beyer knittymelissa on ravelry these socks use a chevron pattern divided by horizontal welts of garter stitch often known as welting fantastic the pattern creates ripples that will showcase a self-striping yarn with wide 5- 8 row regular stripes but will also be striking with a non-regular striping solid or tonal yarn the ripples remind me of rolling hills or mountains in the distance so as i was driving through the berkshire mountains in western massachusetts that seemed a perfect name for this pattern sizes medium - 66 sts large - 78 sts gauge 9 spi stitches per inch in stockinette photo & sock by writergirl3 for narrower socks resize with a smaller gauge reduce needle size and/or use a lighter fingering weight yarn more than 420 yds per 100g to make the pattern larger use larger needles with heavier fingering or even sport weight yarn materials 100 grams fingering weight sock yarn us size 1 2 25mm circular needle note this pattern is written for magic loop but can be adapted to dpns or two circulars stitch markers & tapestry needle stitch key & abbreviations co cast on k knit k2tog knit 2 stitches together decrease k1tbl knit stitch through the back loop kfb knit into the front and the back of the next stitch increase p purl p2tog purl 2 stitches together decrease pm place marker s1 slip 1 stitch as if to purl with yarn in back unless otherwise noted ssk slip next 2 stitches knitwise one at a time then knit slipped stitches together through the back loops decrease wyib with yarn in back ©knittymelissa melissa beyer 2014 1 do not copy sell or distribute without permission instructions cuff co 66 78 sts loosely distribute stitches so there are half on each side of the circular needle the first 33 39 stitches will make up the front of the leg needle 1 the remaining 33 39 stitches are the back of the leg needle 2 join in the round being careful not to twist work k1tbl p1 twisted rib for 1 or to desired cuff length leg work leg chart for your size - each row of the chart will be knit 6 times per round 3 times on needle 1 and 3 times on needle 2 repeat the chart until leg is 6 long or to desired length stopping after working row 5 or 12 note if using a self-striping yarn where each color lasts several row 3-4 or more row could be added or removed in the chart so that each section chevron or garter welts lasts the duration of one color heel heel flap the heel flap will be worked back and forth over the previous 33 39 sts needle 2 - sole the remaining stitches will be on hold for the top of the foot needle 1 - instep and are unworked for now turn your work to start on the ws row 1 ws s1 wyif
